events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at a busy intersection, causing significant damage to their vehicle.
The claim has been reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of the collision and vehicle involvement.
An insurance agent has been assigned to manage the claim and contact the customer for further details and next steps.
Acknowledgement of the accident claim has been sent to the insured with expected timelines for processing and investigation.
The customer has been asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to support the claim.
The insured submitted all requested documents including photos of the collision damage and an official police report.
The investigation team has started reviewing the submitted evidence, including damage assessments and third-party accounts.
Investigation into the accident findings has been completed, confirming liability and verifying the extent of damage reported.
A settlement offer based on evaluated damage and coverage limits has been proposed to the claimant for approval.
The insured responded to the settlement proposal expressing satisfaction with the offer and the handling of their claim.
Management has approved the claim amount based on the investigation report and settlement agreement with the insured.
Payment for the approved settlement amount has been issued to the insured's bank account successfully.
The auto accident claim has been officially closed following payment disbursement and confirmation from the customer.
The claim documentation and all related correspondence have been archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
